com.google.gwt.gears.client.localserver
Class ManagedResourceStore

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.google.gwt.gears.client.localserver.ManagedResourceStore

public final class ManagedResourceStore
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

Manages a collection of URLs that are updated atomically, as a group. The Gears local server always serves captured URLs locally. However, a given URL can be captured in one of two ways: as part of an atomic collection of URLs, or individually in an ad-hoc manner. This class manages atomic URL collections; ResourceStore manages ad-hoc URLs. A collection of URLs is defined by a manifest file. The manifest file is based on JSON syntax: { // version of the manifest file format "betaManifestVersion": 1, // version of the set of resources described in this manifest file "version": "my_version_string", // optional "redirectUrl": "login.html", // URLs to be cached (urls relative to the manifest url) "entries": [ { "url": "main.html", "src": "main_offline.html" }, { "url": "main.js" } ] }

Method Detail

checkForUpdate

public void checkForUpdate()
Instructs Gears to check for an updated manifest file (as determined by whether the value of the 'version' attribute in the manifest has changed), and retrieve and atomically update the contained files, as necessary.

See Also:
getUpdateStatus()

getCurrentVersion

public java.lang.String getCurrentVersion()
Returns the version of the set of resources that is currently being served locally, or empty string if no version is currently in use. This value reflects the version attribute from the manifest file only after all resources listed in the manifest file have been cached locally.

Returns:
the current version of empty string if there isn't one

getLastErrorMessage

public java.lang.String getLastErrorMessage()
Returns the last error message reported by this instance. The return value is undefined if the value getUpdateStatus() is not UPDATE_FAILED.

Returns:
the last error message reported by this instance

public double getLastUpdateCheckTime()
Returns the time, in seconds, of the last update.

the time, in seconds, of the last update

the URL of the manifest file currently used by this store

public java.lang.String getRequiredCookie()
Returns the cookie requirements of this store.

Returns:

getUpdateStatus

public int getUpdateStatus()
Returns the update status value of this store.

Returns:
the status of the most recent update operation; one of the UPDATE_* fields

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Returns true if the store is currently enabled, or false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the store is currently enabled, or false otherwise

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the store. If the store is disabled, it does not serve requests locally.

Parameters:
enabled - the new state of the store

setManifestUrl

public void setManifestUrl(java.lang.String manifestUrl)
Sets the URL of the manifest file defining the contents of this store.

Parameters:
manifestUrl - the URL of the manifest file

setOnCompleteHandler

public void setOnCompleteHandler(ManagedResourceStoreCompleteHandler handler)
Sets the handler to call when the ManagedResourceStore completes an update. Note that updates can be either started explicitly, by calling checkForUpdate(), or implicitly, when resources are served from the store. An update may or may not result in a new version of the store. If a new version results, the newVersion property of the details object will contain the store's new version string.

Parameters:
handler - handler to call when the ManagedResourceStore completes an update

setOnErrorHandler

public void setOnErrorHandler(ManagedResourceStoreErrorHandler handler)
Sets the handler to call when a ManagedResourceStore update fails. Note that update failure may occur normally when an application is running offline, or if the server is down.

Parameters:
handler - the handler to call when a ManagedResourceStore update fails

setOnProgressHandler

public void setOnProgressHandler(ManagedResourceStoreProgressHandler handler)
Sets the handler to receive update notifications. This event is fired periodically during a ManagedResourceStore update.

Parameters:
handler - to receive update notifications
